CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 3, 1955, pg. 28, reads: "Braddock's FEPC - Harry Stark (fifth from left), newly elected chairman of Braddock's Fair Employment Practices Commission, and commission members, immediately started organizing after Burgess James J. Butler, third from left, swore in the members Tuesday evening at the borough building. Shown on the picture are, left to right, Joseph F. Costello, Peter A. Baverso, Burgess Butler, Henry Weiss, president of the borough council; Stark, the Rev. Byrl F. Wright, the commission's secretary, and Joseph A. Kuznicki. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Members of Braddock Fair Employment Practices Commission, from left: Joseph F. Costello, Peter A. Baverso, Burgess Butler, Henry Weiss, Harry Stark, Rev. Byrl F. Wright, and Joseph A. Kuznicki gathered around table in borough building with 1955 Apter Agency calendar on wall, Braddock
